page.title: 01Main Features Tamar Valley.
page.content:
Gunnislake and District.
Our area consists of certain geological features which include a granite ridge. This ridge links Bodmin moor on the West with Dartmoor on the East. It shelters the whole of the Tamar Valley from the North winds, allowing early fruit and flowers to be grown. The ridge runs across from West to East and the area is cut on the Eastern edge by the River Tamar running from North to South.There is a main road running parallel with the ridge , and a railway linking the area with Plymouth which is approximately 20 miles away. The area is very fertile and most of it is farmland, in the Parish of Calstock.
